main: ^“Hi there, sorry to interrupt. I’m a journalist, can I have a few minutes of your time
^“Oh- hello, sure I can spare a few minutes.”
^“Let me just make some space for you, I'll just move my laptop.”
^“I'm surprised you’re still working. Thank you for making time for me. ”
^“Oh, no worries, it’s not like it's the end of the world.”
^"*chuckles* “You’re in high spirits about all this.”
^“I wouldn't really say high spirits, more like I’m trying not to focus on it.”
^“Is that the reason you are still working?”
^“Kinda, I guess, I’ve just been working my entire life and have nothing else to do.”
^“Well, I understand that, I'm sort of in the same position.
^My work is my life, and for these last few days, I'm gonna spend it doing what I love, what I'm good at.”
^“I wouldn’t necessarily say it's what I love, but I think it's safe to say I'm good at it.”
^“Wait, why do you do it then, don't you have hobbies or loved ones to spend time with?”
^“ I never really cared much for hobbies and for ‘loved ones’.”
^“ I don't have a relationship with them anymore.”

c-0: ^“So you never thought to take a break by doing something less than working?”
^“I mean sure, everyone has thought about that stuff at one stage in their life but I’ve just lost that kinda urge.”

ChoiceOneA: ^"That's unfortunate. Well, what were you used to be interested in?”

c-0: ^“That a little rude, this is my life you're calling sad”
c-1: ^“Its just how it goes when life gets in the way”
^"Well, yes, but that's only if you let it”
c-2: ^“I used to like feeding the ducks in the park, simple, but it was calming, like I was in a different world. ”
^“I think I envy these carefree ducks as odd as that sounds.”
^“Oh, to be a duck in a pond.”

c-0: ^“Wait, but your laptop screen… I thought those were your parents on the home screen. If you aren't close, why have that?
^“That's slightly invasive, but if you must know, the relationship is… complicated”

ChoiceOneB: ^“Well, I’m a journalist it's kinda my job to be intrusive”
^“Oh, I'm so sorry I didn’t mean to intrude, they just caught my eye. Do you mind telling me a little bit about them?”

c-0: ^“Yeah, but I'm not some big scoop, I’m just a person, and I don't appreciate it”
c-1: ^“Um, ok… I guess they expect more from me, and I can give it to them.”
c-2: ^“Don’t worry about it, and since you asked, sure.”
^“I have the typical Indian parents, they expect the best from me and nothing short.
^I’m supposed to dedicate myself to my work, which I have, but I'm still not good enough.”
^“So, although all I want to do is make them proud, I don't really enjoy talking with them.”
^“That sounds painful, loving someone with unreachable expectations. You can never quite get it.”
^“Yeah, but that’s why they are my wallpaper to remind me why I work so hard.”
^“That’s not a way to live, you should work to make yourself proud.”

afterChoiceTwo: ^“You really have a lot going on, you deserve time for yourself to just be.”
^“I wouldn’t even know what to do with myself.”
^“Plus, I can't just leave this work unfinished, it just feels wrong when I'm so close to  finishing.”
^“Okay, how's this? I’m going to help you finish this work. Then you are going to let me take you out to show you the world you have been missing.”
^“Honestly, I have no reason to say no, so yes, let's do it. I only have some paperwork and I have to digitise some stuff.”
^"Oh, and thank you for talking to me."
